Class WeatherCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.cwfgm.psaas.api.weather.WeatherCalculator

  • public abstract class WeatherCalculator
extends Object
    Fetch current weather conditions.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void fetchWeather()
      Get the current weather conditions for the specified province and city.
      abstract String[] getCities()
      Get a list of supported cities for the current province.
      String getCity()
      The city to fetch the forecast for.
      String getProvince()
      The province to fetch the forecast for (can be either the full name or abbreviation).

      The current relative humidity (%).

      The current temperature (in celsius).

      The observation time for the weather conditions.

      • getProvince

        public String getProvince()
        The province to fetch the forecast for (can be either the full name or abbreviation).

      • getCity

        public String getCity()
        The city to fetch the forecast for. Must be one of the predefined cities for the specified province.

      • setCity

        public void setCity(String city)
        Set the city to fetch the forecast for.

      • getTime

        public String getTime()
        The observation time for the weather conditions.

        The current wind speed (km/h).

      • getWindDirection

        public double getWindDirection()
        The current wind direction (degrees).

      • fetchWeather

        public abstract void fetchWeather()
                           throws IOException
        Get the current weather conditions for the specified province and city.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getCities

        public abstract String[] getCities()
                            throws IOException
        Get a list of supported cities for the current province.
        Returns:
        A list of cities supported for the current province. If no province or an invalid province is set null will be returned.
        Throws:
        IOException
